pageContext.description: Nine tubular beads, each of which is rolled out of a thin plate. Their sides not being soldered together. 5 are unornamented, 4 are grooved on their outer surface. Their condition is poor.
pageContext.publications: Wilde, Proc. Royal Irish Academy VIII, p. 407,Ibid,Wilde wrote: "They may have been ferrules for double conical beads....or they may have been worn with other trinkets on a necklace, or strung between amber beads....In their present state they cannot be regarded as perfect."
pageContext.collection: National Museum of Science and Art, Dublin,Plate XIV, W. 296/305,Purchased from Mr. Donegan
pageContext.museumCollection: National Museum of Science & Art, Dublin
pageContext.museumID: Plate XIV, W. 296/305,Purchased from Mr. Donegan
